definitions: a branch of the US armed forces, under the Department of Transportation since 1967, responsible for the enforcement of maritime law and for the protection of life and property at sea. In time of war, or at the direction of the president, the Coast Guard serves as part of the US Navy.
shortDefinitions: branch of US armed forces, under Department of Transportation since 1967

definitions: a civilian or volunteer organization keeping watch on the sea near a coast in order to assist people or ships in danger and to prevent smuggling.
shortDefinitions: civilian or volunteer organization keeping watch on sea near coast

definitions: a member of a federal or civilian coast guard organization.
shortDefinitions: member of such federal or civilian organization
